title: Making Most Of Lockdowns, Facebook Gaming Launches Earlier Than Planned
text: Capitalizing on stay-at-home orders and lockdowns, Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) accelerated the launch of a dedicated gaming stream app.

title: Facebook and Google Will Have to Pay to Publish News in Australia
text: With the COVID-19 pandemic hurting media companies and with little chance of a voluntary agreement,  the tech content payment rule in Australia will be mandatory.

title: Facebook Still Wants a Piece of the Cryptocurrency Market
text: The social networking giant isn’t abandoning its fintech dreams.

text: The social media titan accelerated its plans in the gaming space due to the pandemic.

title: Facebook launches COVID-19 data maps for the US, will take its symptom tracking efforts global
text: Many, many symptoms trackers have launched during the coronavirus pandemic, but few with the potential to reach even a bucketful of Facebook’s vast ocean of users. title: Coronavirus could push Apple, Google, Amazon, Facebook deeper into our wallets
text: Tech companies have been eyeing our wallets for years. Now they might just get them.

title: Facebook releases national map showing coronavirus symptoms
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +0.64% on Monday made available a national map of how counties are impacted by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Australia orders Facebook, Google to pay local media a portion of ad revenue
text: Facebook and Google will now have to pay local media firms a cut of the advertising revenue they rake in when using their content, the Australian government said Monday.

title: This Is Instagram's Opportunity to Make IGTV a Success
text: The long-form video platform has struggled to build a network of creators and viewers.

title: Google and Facebook must pay media for content reuse, says Australia
text: The Australia government has said it will adopt a mandatory code to require tech giants such as Google and Facebook to pay local media for reusing their content.

title: Will Facebook’s Gaming App Compete?
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is getting into mobile gaming yet again, as the social media giant has announced an app to capitalize on this growing trend.

title: Facebook’s new Gaming app launches on Android, with iOS version coming soon
text: Facebook’s dedicated Gaming app is now live on Android, months before its planned June release. The social media giant pushed the app out two months prior to its scheduled unveiling amid a global pandemic that’s left people all over the world isolated at home, rapidly burning through entertainment options.

title: Facebook maps out coronavirus symptoms across US
text: The map uses data from a symptom survey run by researchers at Carnegie Mellon.

title: Facebook just released its coronavirus symptom tracking map
text: More than one million people responded to the symptom survey within the first two weeks, Facebook said. It plans to roll out the survey globally this week.

title: How Big Tech is holding up during the coronavirus crisis
text: Mitchell Green, managing partner at Lead Edge Capital, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss how the tech sector has been performing over the past month and what investors can expect going forward.

title: Facebook launches Fundraisers in India, expands partnerships with state governments for WhatsApp and Messenger helplines

title: Facebook is launching a dedicated gaming app to take on Twitch and YouTube
text: Facebook is launching dedicated app for people to create and watch live gameplay.

title: Facebook to launch live game streaming app to compete with rivals
text: The battle of the U.S tech giants is not a new one for the business world. In recent development, Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) announced on Sunday that it will launch its gaming mobile application sooner than originally planned to pose a serious competition to Microsoft’s Mixer services, Google’s Youtube, and Amazon’s Twitch.

title: Facebook’s Stock Down 17%, Will It Fall Further?
text: Facebook stock is down almost 17% since the beginning of this year, at the current price of $176 per share, as the spread of the novel Coronavirus rattles the stock markets and the broader economy. text: Federal government pushes ahead with plans despite similar schemes having limited success overseas
